items.title: Lasers Etch Precise Marks on Small Titanium Devices
Workers Believe Robots Are More a Help Than a Hindrance
items.author: sprovierij@bnpmedia.com (John Sprovieri)
items.summary:
- From GM's 1961 Unimate to today, robots shifted from feared job threats to essential factory helpers.
- A global Messe Munchen survey finds workers see robots as boosting *productivity* and *safety*, not stealing jobs.
- In the U.S., 69% say robots help with shortages and 75% say they reduce injuries, while China 82% and Japan 72% show higher optimism.

items.title: Boeing Strike Ends as Union Approves New Contract
items.summary:
- After a **three-month** strike, about 3,200 IAMAW members voted **68%** in favor of a new five-year contract at Boeing Defense in St. Louis.
- The pact includes a **$6,000 signing bonus** (up from $5,000) and a **24% general wage increase** (8% first year, then 4% annually), but omits a **$10,000 ratification bonus** and 401(k) match.
- The agreement aims to restore stability with all members returning to work, while unions push for improved benefits in future negotiations amid concerns about military readiness.

items.title: Suppliers Navigate Lidar Assembly Challenges
Stellantis to Build Midsize Truck at Illinois Plant
items.summary:
- *Stellantis* plans to reopen the Belvidere plant in 2027 to build a new *midsize truck*, signaling a strategic shift.
- The company has canceled plans for a fully electric Ram pickup and Jeep Gladiator 4xe, leaving the truck's powertrain undecided (**electric** vs *gas*).
- About 960 workers are on recall as the plant eyes a 2027 launch after a DOE electrification grant, with electrification funding at issue.

items.title: Humanoid Robots Complete Trial Project at BMW Assembly Plant
items.summary:
- Two *Figure AI* *Figure 02* humanoids completed an 11‑month pilot at BMW's Spartanburg body shop, logging 1,250 hours and handling 90,000+ parts toward more than 30,000 BMW X3 vehicles. 
- The robots performed a classic *pick-and-place* task, chasing cycle targets (37 s load, 84 s per task) with 99% per‑shift accuracy, while forearm and *wrist electronics* redesigns improved reliability and thermal management. 
- Insights from the run informed the upcoming *Figure 03* design, highlighting reliability, rapid adaptation, and reduced hardware failures for future automotive automation.

items.title: Rockwell Automation to Build Assembly Plant in Wisconsin
items.summary:
- Rockwell Automation will build a new greenfield site in southeastern Wisconsin as part of a **$2B** investment in plants, digital infrastructure and talent.
- The facility, over 1 million sq ft, will feature *advanced automation*, robotics, AI and analytics to boost efficiency and training.
- The project aims to grow Rockwell’s U.S. manufacturing footprint and could become the company’s largest global campus.

items.title: First Solar Opens $1.1B AI Plant in Louisiana
items.summary:
- First Solar opened a $1.1B, *2.4-million-square-foot* plant in *Iberia Parish, LA*, employing 700+ workers (826 by year‑end) with a *3.5 GW/yr* output.
- The facility uses AI for defect detection and process tuning, sourcing *American-made materials* (glass from Illinois and Ohio; steel in Mississippi; rails in Louisiana) to meet FEOC guidance.
- It anchors a large Western Hemisphere solar‑tech footprint with sister plants in Ohio and Alabama, plus R&D in OH/CA, and a parallel *$330M* onshore line for Series 6 production in Gaffney, SC.

items.title: The Connected Worker Manufacturing Stack
GM Wins 4 R&D 100 Awards for Breakthrough Tech
items.summary: - GM earns four R&D 100 Awards, underscoring leadership in *digital manufacturing*, *battery science*, *propulsion efficiency*, and *advanced materials*.\n- **DR-Weld** simulates welding and additive manufacturing thousands of times faster, cutting development time from months to days.\n- Breakthroughs include an **ultra-fast-charging cell architecture**, a **low-mass, high-efficiency medium-duty engine**, and a **silicon all-solid-state battery**, signaling long-term impact on mobility and manufacturing.

items.title: GM Invests $250M in Parma Metal Center (OH)
items.summary:
- *GM's $250M Parma Metal Center investment expands stamping and assembly to support production at Orion (MI), Spring Hill (TN), and Fairfax (KS).*
- *The broader $5.5B 2025 plan aims to boost domestic capacity, resilience, and support for ICE and EV lines.*
- *Parma Metal Center has operated for 75+ years, producing over 100M parts annually and handling 400 tons of steel daily.*

items.title: Chrysler Thrived, But Also Struggled to Survive
Digit Moves 100K Totes at GXO Site
items.summary:
- The humanoid *Digit* at GXO's Flowery Branch facility surpassed **100,000 totes**, showing *scalable* and *adaptable* automation without major facility changes.
- Agility's AI pipeline blends traditional control, teleoperation, reinforcement learning, and simulation to enable *dynamic balancing* and *vision-driven grasping* in real-world workflows.
- Safety and trust underpin long-term human–robot collaboration, building regulatory and operational foundations for future scaling of humanoid systems.

items.title: Dual-Cure Potting Compound and Other New Bonding Products
Software Saves Time When Programming Robotic Welding
Automation Boosts Efficiency at Drive Manufacturer
Join Ductile Metals With Cold Welding
Toyota Expands Hybrid Production Across Five U.S. Plants
items.summary:
- Toyota commits a $912 million investment to upgrade *machining*, *casting*, and *electric-drive* component manufacturing at its U.S. plants in West Virginia, Kentucky, Tennessee, and Missouri. 
- In Kentucky, the largest U.S. plant will install a new *machining line* for hybrid-capable engines, enabling up to 700,000 annual powertrain units when production launches in 2027. 
- Mississippi will start U.S.-assembled hybrid Corolla production at Blue Springs, while the expansions also bolster Toyota’s U.S. hybrid supply chain with additional lines for hybrid transaxle cases, housings, and engine blocks.

items.title: Emirates & Safran to Build Dubai Seat Plant
items.summary:
- Emirates and **Safran Seats** sign an MoU to build a new aircraft seat facility in **Dubai**, initially for *Business and Economy Class* retrofit seats with plans to expand to line-fit production.
- The site will boost regional capacity, streamline supply chains for **Emirates** and other **Safran** customers, and use advanced automation to meet rising global seating demand.
- Spanning 20,000–25,000 m², the plant aims to assemble up to 1,000 **Business Class** seats per year at ramp-up, with completion targeted for Q4 2027.

items.title: Three Ways Leaders Can Counteract Supply Chain Cost Increases
Fasteners Enable Creation of Robotic Salad Bar
From CAD to Clarity: Why Automated Work Instructions Are the Critical Step in Reindustrializing the West
PHD Expands Air-on-Demand Product Line
Presses Will Be Vital for Assembling ‘Green’ Technologies
Toyota Ramps Up Battery Production in North Carolina
items.author: webera@bnpmedia.com (Austin Weber)
items.summary: - *Toyota* has opened a **$14B** lithium-ion battery plant in **Liberty, NC**, with 14 lines and a potential 30 GWh/year.\n- The site will employ **>5,000** local workers and power HEVs, BEVs, and PHEVs like the Camry HEV and RAV4 HEV.\n- Toyota plans to invest up to **$10B** in the U.S. over five years and donate **$2.7M** to Driving Possibilities in Guilford County and Asheboro schools.

items.title: Honda Invests to Build Small Parts On-Site
items.summary:
- Honda is investing $9.6M to modernize the Swepsonville, NC plant, enabling *on-site production* of *ATV components* such as rear and front fenders, side covers, toolbox covers, and other small items.
- The upgrade will create 18 new jobs and provide upskilling opportunities over five years while boosting *production flexibility* and reducing operating costs.
- Sustainability measures include a plastic pelletizer to recycle scrap, curb waste, and shift to *electric-powered systems* to lower the plant's carbon footprint.

items.title: RIT Launches Electronics Training for Veterans
items.summary:
- RIT launches a two-year program backed by *$700,000* to train *veterans and under-employed individuals* in electronics assembly and semiconductor processing.
- The program offers hands-on instruction at the *Center for Electronic Manufacturing and Assembly (CEMA)* with certifications aligned to national standards.
- Over two years, six cohorts will train *60 veterans* in the *Greater Rochester area*, with employer outreach and pathways to further study.

items.title: Boeing Breaks Ground on $1B SC Expansion
items.summary:
- Boeing has begun a $1B expansion at Boeing South Carolina to boost the *787* output toward a **10 per month** rate by 2026.
- The plan adds a new **1.2-million-square-foot** final assembly building, plus new parts-prep and vertical fin paint facilities, Flight Line stalls, and expanded interiors work at the Airport Campus.
- Over five years, the project is expected to create about **1,000 jobs** as demand for the *787* remains strong and a global need for **7,800+** widebody jets is forecast.

items.title: Hyundai Opens Georgia EV Training Center
items.summary:
- The 89,000‑sq‑ft Hyundai Mobility Training Center of Georgia in Ellabell will train up to 824 workers at a time to support *Georgia*’s growing EV/hybrid manufacturing.
- It features the *STEP Line*, *IMPACT Line* with 53 operations, a *High-Voltage Battery & Safety Lab*, a *VR Experience Lab*, and an *Automation & Mechatronics Lab* for hands-on, production training.
- The center mirrors Hyundai’s assembly plant to ensure a seamless classroom‑to‑floor transition and backs Hyundai's plan to create about 8,500 jobs in *Georgia* by 2031.

items.title: UMaine Engineers Develop Lighter, Stronger Printed Parts
How to Overcome the Technology “Value Void” in Manufacturing
Stellantis Factory Booster Day spotlights innovations
items.summary:
- Stellantis marked its 10th Factory Booster Day by spotlighting 100+ innovations from 80 suppliers, signaling a shift to *AI-enabled*, automated, and *sustainable* operations.
- The **2025 Innovation Awards** honored advances like predictive maintenance, VR retooling, paint-oven monitoring, optimized Body-in-White material use, ski hemming welding, and quiet-gear EV design.
- Open Challenge demonstrations, showcased at Booster Day, have been deployed across Stellantis plants worldwide to drive real production benefits.

items.title: PI Moves into New US HQ to Support Growth and Innovation
items.summary:
- PI moved into a larger Shrewsbury, MA HQ to expand *U.S. production*, engineering, and customer support for precision motion control.
- The new facility serves photonics, semiconductor, aerospace, and life sciences while helping mitigate trade pressures and accelerate *R&D* and tech development.
- Upgraded spaces include production, service, metrology, clean rooms, and expanded demo/training areas to support *growth* and faster delivery.

items.title: Igus Opens Lead Screw Plant in Rhode Island
items.summary:
- Igus opened a 110,000-square-foot facility in East Providence, RI to manufacture *lead screws*, with production slated to start in 2026.
- The plant, Dryspin’s first outside Germany, will enable *in-house machining* and strengthen domestic supply chains to shorten lead times for **North American customers**.
- According to Matt Mowry, moving production under their own roof provides better control of the value stream and improved service for **North American customers**.

items.title: Systems Integrator Kinemetrix Opens Expanded HQ in Kentucky
Four New Cobots Hit the Market
items.summary:
- The *cobot* market remains the hottest segment in *automation*, with sales projected to grow at **31%** CAGR over the next five years.
- This episode spotlights several new cobots released this year and topics like Isuzu's SC plant, vibratory bowls for handles, and *AI* that teaches robots to assemble with Legos, plus a McLaren simulator.
- Tune in monthly for the latest in assembly tech and try the Ask ASM AI search tool for quick answers.

items.title: Affordable Custom Integration with existing product lines: Why retrofitting Automation makes financial sense
Aircraft Manufacturers Ramp Up Next-Gen Factories
Rockwell Starts Production of OTTO AMRs in Milwaukee
items.summary:
- Rockwell Automation starts production in Milwaukee for the *OTTO 600* and *OTTO 1200* AMRs, expanding capacity after its 2023 Clearpath Robotics acquisition.
- The AMRs use laser scanners to map spaces at more than 30 scans per second, build a shared virtual map, and maintain awareness of other robots (even around corners) to boost safety and efficiency, with each unit driving more than 15 miles before shipping.
- The Milwaukee site adds 25,000 square feet of capacity while production continues in Ontario to serve U.S. customers.

items.title: Tips for Assembling Micro-medical Devices
Four US Cities Top List of Global Innovation Clusters
items.summary: - *WIPO's Global Innovation Index* maps top clusters by the density of inventors, scientists, and venture capital activity, often spanning borders. - In 2025, the top 10 includes Shenzhen–Hong Kong–Guangzhou, Tokyo–Yokohama, San Jose–San Francisco, Beijing, Seoul, Shanghai–Suzhou, New York City, London, Boston–Cambridge, and Los Angeles, with four U.S. metros among them. - *China* leads with 24 clusters, the U.S. 22, and Germany seven, showing cross-border networks that extend beyond single cities.

items.title: Medical Device Firm Invests $20M in PA Plant
items.summary:
- **$20 million** investment to expand and modernize the *Hanover Township* assembly plant, creating at least **200 new full‑time jobs** and retaining **1,704** positions.
- Pennsylvania provides **$1.5 million** in support—**$1 million Pennsylvania First grant** and **$500,000 WEDnetPA**—to train workers, plus a new workforce training center at the site.
- The *Lehigh Valley* region hosts more than **170 life‑sciences establishments** employing over **6,000** people, underscoring a robust local ecosystem.

items.title: Honda Halts Production at Mexico Assembly Plant Over Chip Shortage
items.summary:
- Honda halted the Celaya, Mexico plant due to a *semiconductor shortage* tied to a Dutch-Chinese chipmaker dispute, the first confirmed impact on a Japanese automaker.
- Production is being trimmed in the U.S. and Canada, with *North American output* reduced as *chip supplies tighten*.
- The wider auto sector faces ongoing disruptions as *Nexperia*-related constraints and export blocks ripple through supply chains, with potential cuts also eyed in *Brazil* and other manufacturers.

items.title: Dispensing Technology Supplier Coherix Expands
items.summary:
- Coherix is expanding in Ann Arbor with a 25,000-sq-ft facility (+$1M) to boost production and product development, adding 10–15 engineering jobs.
- The Innovation Center will house 10 robotic dispensing stations and demo areas, powered by *AI* and *3D-vision-enabled adaptive process control* for adhesive dispensing.
- The move aims to meet demand, accelerate *precision dispensing technology* development, and partner with EMA and Eastern Michigan University for education and future factory initiatives.

items.title: Foxconn to Deploy Humanoid Robots on Production Line at Houston AI Server Plant
HOLON Opens First U.S. Facility in Jacksonville
items.summary:
- **HOLON** will build a 580,000-square-foot facility at *Eastport Industrial Park* in Jacksonville, Florida, marking its first U.S. manufacturing site for autonomous shuttles.
- Groundbreaking is scheduled for April 2026 with operations expected in the second half of 2027, and the project will generate over *$200 million* in local economic impact during construction, create more than 800 jobs (including at least 150 at **HOLON**), and deliver about *$87 million* in annual economic output starting in 2028.
- The vehicle meets **FMVSS**, **ADA**, and **Build America, Buy America (BABA)** standards; test drives are underway in Hamburg as part of the ALIKE project; and up to 100 autonomous shuttles could be integrated into JTA’s *Ultimate Urban Circulator (U²C)* program in downtown Jacksonville and other U.S. pilots planned for 2026 and beyond.

items.title: GrayMatter Robotics to polish transparent plastics
items.summary:
- The U.S. Air Force awarded GrayMatter Robotics a contract to develop an **AI-powered** robotic polishing system to reduce optical distortion in transparent acrylic and polycarbonate parts.
- The system extends GrayMatter's existing technology that autonomously detects and corrects distortions to ensure *clear visibility* and scratch-free surfaces on aerospace components, using physics-based models for safe, accurate operation.
- CTO Brual Shah says the platform can handle sanding complex shapes—from guitars to aerospace components—delivering unprecedented *reliability*, speed, and consistency.

items.title: Course Teaches Plastic Parts for Automotive Design
items.summary:
- *Three-day course* in Troy, MI teaches how to design plastic parts for automotive applications, led by Paul A. Tres.
- Topics cover *material selection*, *design procedures*, processing and assembly methods including in-mold assembly, living hinges, over-molding, press-fit, snap-fits and safety systems.
- Attendees receive the 10th edition of "Designing Plastic Parts for Assembly" and a binder with over 1,300 slides; course runs Nov. 5–7 at Michigan State University.

items.title: Battery Manufacturer Bringing 735 New Jobs to Pennsylvania
items.summary:
- **Eos Energy Enterprises** is expanding in Allegheny County, PA with a **$352.9M** investment, relocating HQ from New Jersey and creating **735 new jobs** (265 retained).
- The plan adds a 432,000 sq ft Marshall Township facility, new lines, and a **40,000 sq ft** Pittsburgh HQ to support its BMS, software, controls, and analytics, with a **Carnegie Mellon** partnership to grow robotics/AI skills.
- Founded in 2008, Eos makes aqueous zinc batteries for utilities and industry, aligning growth with local universities for a skilled workforce.

items.title: Chrysler: A Century of Innovation
